cards.prevent: Use two warnings and a visual timer before the change.
cards.say: Two more minutes, then shoes. Red or blue shoes?
cards.do: Move close, point to timer, then guide body calmly toward next step.
cards.ifEscalates: Hold limit with one sentence and help their body move through.
cards.evidence: Predictable transitions reduce uncertainty and protest intensity.

cards.prevent: Add one tiny connection ritual before every hard transition.
cards.say: One hug, then we walk together to the car.
cards.do: Offer brief connection, then start movement without reopening negotiation.
cards.ifEscalates: Name feeling, keep boundary, and reduce language to one line.
cards.evidence: Connection-before-demand can lower resistance during transitions.

cards.prevent: Keep routine order identical nightly and dim lights 30 minutes early.
cards.say: Bath, books, bed. Same plan, I am with you.
cards.do: Use calm pace, short phrases, and repeat sequence without adding new steps.
cards.ifEscalates: Stay present, lower voice, and repeat only the next routine step.
cards.evidence: Consistent routines support faster settling and lower bedtime conflict.

cards.prevent: Preview one bedtime limit before routine starts.
cards.say: I hear you want one more book. Tonight we keep our two-book plan.
cards.do: Validate once, restate limit once, then continue with body-based guidance.
cards.ifEscalates: Pause talking, breathe with them, and continue bedtime sequence.
cards.evidence: Warmth plus clear limits reduces escalation from repeated negotiations.

cards.prevent: Agree on a short outing plan and exit cue before entering.
cards.say: You are upset. I will help. We are stepping outside now.
cards.do: Reduce stimulation, move to quiet spot, and prioritize safety over teaching.
cards.ifEscalates: Contain physically if needed, keep voice low, and shorten sentences.
cards.evidence: Lowering sensory input and moving to safety decreases escalation duration.

cards.prevent: Use snack, bathroom, and transition checks before crowded settings.
cards.say: Big feelings happened. You are safe with me.
cards.do: After calm returns, reconnect briefly and practice one simple redo behavior.
cards.ifEscalates: Skip coaching and return to co-regulation first.
cards.evidence: Repair after regulation helps learning without adding shame.

cards.prevent: Convert commands into two acceptable choices when possible.
cards.say: It is time to leave. Do you hop or tiptoe to the door?
cards.do: Offer two choices once, then guide follow-through without adding options.
cards.ifEscalates: Acknowledge feeling and proceed with the original two choices only.
cards.evidence: Bounded choice supports autonomy while keeping adult structure.

cards.prevent: Use short first-then language before known refusal points.
cards.do: Point to visual first-then cue and immediately start first task together.
cards.ifEscalates: Shrink task to smallest next action and keep first-then wording.
cards.evidence: First-then structure improves compliance in high-refusal moments.

cards.prevent: State one shared play rule before conflict-prone activities.
cards.say: Hands stay safe. I will help you both solve this.
cards.do: Separate bodies, narrate each need briefly, then give one turn-taking step.
cards.ifEscalates: Keep children physically apart and coach one child at a time.
cards.evidence: Clear safety boundaries plus coaching reduces sibling escalation.

cards.prevent: Practice a short repair script during calm moments daily.
cards.say: Try: 'I did not like that. I need space.'
cards.do: Coach exact words, prompt eye contact only if calm, then reset activity.
cards.ifEscalates: Return to safety script and postpone repair conversation until calm.
cards.evidence: Rehearsed repair language improves conflict recovery over time.

cards.prevent: Use a 10-second pause cue when you feel your body speeding up.
cards.say: I need one calm breath so I can help you.
cards.do: Step back safely, exhale longer than inhale three times, then respond.
cards.ifEscalates: Move to regulate flow first, then return with one short script.
cards.evidence: Brief physiological regulation improves parent response quality.

cards.prevent: Preload a repair line so you can reconnect quickly after rupture.
cards.say: I yelled. That was not okay. I am here to reset with you.
cards.do: Own action, restate safety, and offer one specific next step together.
cards.ifEscalates: Keep repair brief and return to calm co-regulation before teaching.
cards.evidence: Rapid repair supports attachment security after conflict.
